name: Three Pot
description:
This algorithm allows you to run what are effectively DSP 'plug-ins', loaded from the MicroSD card. It was designed particularly to support programs written for the Spin Semiconductor FV-1 chip, a popular IC used in various Eurorack modules like FX Aid and Timiszoara. The name 'Three Pot' comes from the FV-1 hardware design, which features stereo inputs/outputs and three pots for user controls.

Although primarily focused on converted FV-1 programs, the algorithm translates these to C++ and compiles them for the disting NT, enabling direct C++ programming as well. Programs are stored in JSON format with a '.3pot' extension inside the `/programs/three_pot` folder on the MicroSD card.

The 'Pre/post gain' parameter adjusts signal levels between normalized FV-1 DSP (±1.0) and disting NT's voltage range (±10.0V). The UI dynamically displays program names, pot labels, descriptions, and allows direct control of three physical pots mapped to the program parameters.
short_description: Runs DSP code from the SD card
use_cases: Running converted FV-1 programs on disting NT
Custom DSP patching via MicroSD-loaded programs
gui_description: The UI dynamically shows the program name, pot labels, and description from the loaded .3pot file. The three physical pots on the disting NT directly control the first three parameters of the selected program. The right encoder is used to change programs. During program selection, the display shows a detailed description of the chosen program.
